task.title: Removing and Replacing the Commutator
task.shortdesc: Remove the commutator assembly from the engine and properly reinstall it, ensuring correct alignment with the first cylinder's exhaust valve.

prereq.p: Before beginning this procedure, ensure you have access to:

context.p: The commutator must be properly removed to perform maintenance or replacement. Correct reinstallation is critical for engine timing.

step.cmd: Remove the cotter pin from the spark rod
Detach the spark rod from the commutator
Loosen the cap screw that passes through the breather pipe
step.info: This screw is located on top of the timing gear cover
The loosened cap screw will have released the holding spring, allowing easy removal

step.cmd: Remove the brush from the cam shaft

result.p: The commutator assembly is now fully disassembled and removed from the engine.

ol.li: Remove the valve door to observe No. 1 valve operation
Position the brush so it points upward when the first cylinder's exhaust valve is closed
Verify proper alignment before completing reassembly

postreq.note: Correct brush alignment is critical for proper engine timing and operation.
